columns.text: In this problem, we will solve for the net present value of the project using the given parameters.

The net present value of a project projects the annual return over the lifespan of a project. It is a good indication of the project's profitability. 

To get the net present value (NPV), we will use this formula:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{NPV}&=\text{cashflow at the start}+\dfrac{\text{cash flow Year 1}}{(1+\text{Required return})^1}\\
&+\dfrac{\text{cash flow Year 2}}{(1+\text{Required return})^2}+\dfrac{\text{cash flow Year 3}}{(1+\text{Required return})^3}\\
&+\dfrac{\text{cash flow Year 4}}{(1+\text{Required return})^4}+\dfrac{\text{cash flow Year 5}}{(1+\text{Required return})^5}\\
&+\dfrac{\text{Net working capital}+\text{After-tax salvage value}}{(1+\text{Required return})^5}
\end{aligned}$$

For the cashflow at the start, we will simply add the initial cost as well as the net working capital.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{cash flow at the start}&=\$460,000+\$29,000\\[15 pt]
&=\$489,000
\end{aligned}$$

Since both of these are expenses, then the cash flow at the start is $-\$489,000$

For the after-tax salvage value, we can simply take the salvage value and multiply it to one minus the tax rate. 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{After-tax salvage value}&=\$55,000 \times(1-0.21)\\[15 pt]
&=\$43,450
\end{aligned}$$

The after-tax salvage value of the equipment is $\$43,450$

For the depreciation, we will use the straight-line method which simply means that we will divide the initial cost of the equipment by the length of its lifespan. 

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Depreciation}&=\dfrac{\$460,000}{5}\\[15 pt]
&=\$92,000
\end{aligned}$$

The depreciation of the equipment is $\$92,00$ per year.

Substituting the values, we can solve for the cash flow using the formula in Step 5.

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{Cash flow}&=\$155,000 \times (1-0.21)+0.21\times\$92,000\\[15 pt]
&=\$141,770
\end{aligned}$$

The annual cash flow is $\$141,770$

Substituting the known values to get the NPV using the formula in Step 2, we will get:

$$\begin{aligned}
\text{NPV}&=-\$489,000+\dfrac{\$141,770}{1.10^1}+\dfrac{\$141,770}{1.10^2}\\
&+\dfrac{\$141,770}{1.10^3}+\dfrac{\$141,770}{1.10^4}+\dfrac{\$141,770}{1.10^5}\\
&+\dfrac{\$43,450+\$29,000}{1.10^5}\\[15 pt]
&=\$93,405.59
\end{aligned}$$

The net present value of this is $\$93,405.59$
